name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid has a melting point that is influenced by its functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +30°C. The fluorine atoms also contribute to the melting point due to their increased molecular weight and the rigidity they bring, estimated at around +10°C each. The hydroxyl group introduces hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5°C. The carbonyl group introduces a polar carbonyl interaction, estimated at around +30°C. The trifluoromethyl group also introduces a rigid structure, estimated at around +10°C.
